newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Samsung wins General Electric licence.
newsitem.headline: Samsung wins General Electric licence.

text.p: South Korea's Samsung Aerospace Industries Co said on Monday it had won a licence from General Electric Co of the United States to make gas turbines for use in industrial machinery and power generation.
Samsung will begin making General Electric's LM series of turbines in South Korea from early 1998, Samsung spokesman Shin Sang-yong said.
Samsung Aerospace, a unit of the Samsung Group SAGR.CN, expects to produce about 10 turbines in 1998 mainly for domestic sales, he said.
"The technology that we will obtain from the cooperation agreement will be applied to our production of airplane engines in the future," he said.
He declined to give commercial terms on the deal.
